official-title.#text: To enable hospital-based nursing programs that are affiliated with a hospital to maintain payments under the Medicare program to hospitals for the costs of such programs.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Making the Education of Nurses Dependable for Schools Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Making the Education of Nurses Dependable for Schools Act

header.#text: Enabling hospital-based nursing programs that are affiliated with a hospital to maintain Medicare payments for the costs of such programs

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: to providers for the costs of nursing and allied health education activities for cost reporting periods beginning on or after the date of the enactment of this Act, the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: title XVIII of the Social Security Act
Secretary of Health and Human Services

text.#text: For purposes of clarifying the methodology for payment under the Medicare program under

by treating a provider as meeting all of the requirements described in paragraph (f)(1) of such section if the provider or a wholly owned subsidiary educational institution of such provider singly or collectively meets all of such requirements;

in the case of a provider that would meet the requirements of paragraph (g)(3) of such section, with respect to a nursing or allied health education program, except that the transfer described in such paragraph of such a program to a wholly owned subsidiary educational institution in order to meet accreditation standards occurred after October 1, 2003, by treating such provider as meeting the requirements of such paragraph (and eligible for payments under such paragraph) with respect to such program; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Making the Education of Nurses Dependable for Schools Act/s:2/ss:b

term.#tail: , as referenced in such section, as such term is defined under
has the meaning given such term in

external-xref.#tail: of title 42, Code of Federal Regulations.

term.#tail: means, with respect to a provider, an educational institution that—

text.#text: is organized as a legal entity distinct from the provider;
has the provider as its sole owner or sole member; and
is organized in the same State in which the provider is organized or registered to do business.
